item.title: 中国银行因信贷减值减少而实现利润增长
item.description: 中国银行股份有限公司公布全年利润增长 2.6%，原因是减值减少有助于抵消利率下降带来的压力。【原文：Bank of China Ltd. reported a 2.6% increase in full-year profit as a drop in impairments helped offset pressure from falling interest rates.】

item.title: 贸易战担忧加剧，美国股市流动性趋于枯竭
item.description: 对全球贸易战经济影响的担忧进一步削弱了美股的流动性，令机构投资者头疼不已，这也可能加剧大盘的波动。【原文：Worries over the economic effects of the global trade war are further sapping liquidity in US stocks, creating a headache for institutional investors that could also boost volatility in broader markets.】

item.title: 交易商转而押注利率维持不变，挪威克朗波动率大幅上升
item.description: 在交易商降低了对本周降息的预期后，挪威克朗的波动对冲成本跃升至11月以来的最高水平。【原文：The cost of hedging volatility in the Norwegian krone jumped to the highest level since November after traders pared back expectations for an interest-rate cut this week.】

item.title: 更高效的冷却系统可使印度免受夏季停电之苦
item.description: 美国加州大学伯克利分校的一项研究表明，更高效的空调可能有助于防止印度每年在炎热季节出现的停电现象。【原文：More efficient air-conditioners may help prevent the power cuts that every year overwhelm India during the hot season, according to a study by University of California, Berkeley.】

item.title: 当美国经济数据不可信时怎么办？
item.description:
随着唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）解雇独立监管机构并取消咨询委员会，世界最大经济体的数据可能成为下一个目标。【原文：

With Donald Trump firing independent regulators and killing off advisory committees, data on the world’s largest economy may be next.

】

item.title: 特朗普加征 25% 关税后，信实集团暂停购买委内瑞拉石油
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普授权对购买南美国家石油的国家征收 25% 的关税后，信实工业有限公司已暂停进一步购买委内瑞拉原油。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd. has paused further purchases of Venezuelan crude after US President Donald Trump authorized a 25% tariff on countries buying the South American country’s oil.】

item.title: 德国联盟谈判代表同意取消天然气储存税
item.description: 德国保守党和社会民主党同意取消天然气储存税，以降低能源费用。【原文：Germany’s conservatives and Social Democrats agreed to abolish its gas storage levy in an effort to lower energy bills.】

item.title: 2024 年底西班牙消费者助力经济超越同行
item.description: 去年年底，家庭消费拉动了西班牙的经济扩张，帮助其超过了欧元区其他国家。【原文：Household consumption drove Spain’s economic expansion at the end of last year, helping it outpace its euro-zone peers.】

item.title: 国防承包商以 1 欧元的价格成为欧洲最炙手可热的股票之一
item.description: 由于国防股的繁荣，在一家陷入困境的奥地利发动机制造商身上下的 1 欧元赌注已成为欧洲最热门的投资之一。【原文：A €1 bet on a struggling Austrian engine maker has turned into one of the hottest investments in Europe thanks to the boom in defense stocks.】

item.title: 埃及经济创 2022 年以来最快季度增长速度
item.description: 在前所未有的外国援助浪潮以及更加重视本地工业和出口的推动下，埃及经济以两年多来最快的季度速度增长。【原文：Egypt’s economy grew at its fastest quarterly pace in more than two years, buoyed by an unprecedented wave of foreign assistance and a greater focus on local industry and exports.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行计划出售 4.62 亿欧元西班牙住房贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）正在寻求出售约 4.62 亿欧元（4.98 亿美元）的西班牙抵押贷款组合。【原文：Banco Santander SA is seeking to sell a portfolio of around €462 million ($498 million) in Spanish mortgages, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 瑞银提出投资银行永久上限以缓解瑞士的担忧
item.description: 一位熟知内情的人士透露，瑞银集团高管建议将投资银行规模的永久性上限写入瑞士法律，以减轻政府对未来潜在救援的担忧。【原文：UBS Group AG executives have suggested that a permanent cap on the size of its investment bank be written into Swiss law to alleviate government concerns about a potential future rescue, a person familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美国前高官称中国贸易顺差过大难以接受
item.description: 美国前总统克林顿的最高贸易官员表示，中国的贸易顺差令世界经济 "难以承受"，并警告说，如果不解决助长不平衡的国内原因，中国的出口将面临新的障碍。【原文：China is running a trade surplus that the world economy can’t “live with,” former US President Bill Clinton’s top trade official said, warning its exports would face new roadblocks without fixing the domestic causes fueling the imbalances.】

item.title: 尼日利亚将设立 6.54 亿美元基金提供住房贷款
item.description: 尼日利亚计划建立一个 1 万亿奈拉（约合 6.54 亿美元）的基金，为这个缺少约 2 800 万套住房的国家提供抵押贷款。【原文：Nigeria plans to create a 1 trillion-naira ($654 million) fund to provide mortgages in a nation with a shortfall of about 28 million homes.】

item.title: 中国人民银行顾问称，如果增长放缓，中国将加大刺激力度
item.description: 中国央行的一位顾问说，中国经济今年开局良好，如果增长势头减弱，政府准备采取更多刺激措施。【原文：China’s economy got off to a good start this year and authorities are ready to deploy more stimulus if growth loses momentum, a center bank adviser said.】

item.title: 液化天然气充裕有助于缓解储气担忧，欧洲天然气下滑
item.description: 欧洲天然气继续下滑，原因是液化天然气供应充足，天气转暖，缓解了该地区燃料库存在今年开局不顺后面临的压力。【原文：European natural gas continued its slide as ample supply of LNG and warmer weather ease pressure on the region’s fuel inventories after a rocky start to the year.】

item.title: 法国税务机关利用人工智能打击税务欺诈行为
item.description: 一位专门从事私人财富业务的律师表示，法国政府正在采取越来越严厉的手段来揭露税务欺诈行为。【原文：The French government is deploying increasingly aggressive methods to uncover tax fraud, according to a lawyer who specializes in private wealth.】

item.title: 日本前法官在内幕交易案中被判有罪
item.description: 在银行和证券交易所接连爆出金融丑闻之际，东京一家法院判定一名前法官犯有内幕交易罪。【原文：A Tokyo court found a former judge guilty of insider trading, in a verdict that comes amid a string of financial scandals at banks as well as the stock exchange.】

item.title: 白莲花 "热潮推动泰国岛屿四月酒店预订量增长
item.description: 据泰国政府称，四月份国际游客在宋干节假期的酒店预订量激增，苏梅岛（热播剧《白莲花》的拍摄地）的预订量比去年同期增长了 65%。【原文：Thailand saw a surge in hotel bookings by international visitors for the Songkran holiday in April, with the island of Koh Samui - filming location of the hit series White Lotus - recording a 65% increase from a year ago, according to the government.】

item.title: 英国通胀意外放缓提振降息希望
item.description: 英国通胀率在 2 月份意外降温，这为英国央行在 5 月份再次降息提供了更充分的理由，也为英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）在本周三发表重要经济声明前提供了支持。【原文：UK inflation unexpectedly cooled in February, strengthening the case for the Bank of England to cut interest rates again in May and providing a boost for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ahead of a key economic statement Wednesday.】

item.title: 贝恩收购意大利软件公司 Namirial 大部分股权
item.description: 贝恩资本同意从私募股权公司 Ambienta 收购 Namirial SpA 的多数股权。【原文：Bain Capital agreed to acquire a majority stake in Namirial SpA from private equity firm Ambienta.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）贷款后巴基斯坦经济增长快于预期
item.description: 巴基斯坦上一季度的经济增长速度超过预期，因为金融条件的放宽和降息促进了这个南亚国家的经济复苏。【原文：Pakistan’s economy grew faster than expected last quarter as easing financial conditions and rate cuts bolstered recovery for the South Asian nation.】

item.title: LG 印度首次公开募股的估值预期被认为有所降低
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在印度股市近期下跌之后，LG 电子公司印度分公司首次公开募股的估值可能低于此前预期。【原文：LG Electronics Inc.’s India unit may get a lower valuation than previously expected in its initial public offering, according to people familiar with the development, after the recent decline in the nation’s stock market.】

item.title: 英国 2 月通胀意外放缓
item.description: 伦敦证券交易所。摄影师：Hollie Adams/Bloomberg【原文：The London Stock Exchange. Photographer: Hollie Adams/Bloomberg】

item.title: 在中国人工智能复兴之际，苹果公司首席执行官访问 DeepSeek 的故乡
item.description: 苹果公司首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）访问了中国的人工智能中心杭州，这里是人工智能巨头 DeepSeek 的发源地，DeepSeek 以低于美国竞争对手的成本制造的模型震惊了世界。【原文：Apple Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook visited China’s artificial intelligence hub of Hangzhou, the home of AI sensation DeepSeek which shocked the world with its models built at a fraction of the cost of American rivals.】

item.title: 埃尔多安在令市场震惊的镇压行动中赢得特朗普赞誉
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普赞扬了土耳其总统雷杰普-塔伊普-埃尔多安（Recep Tayyip Erdogan），为这个在镇压反对派的行动中面临一周国内抗议和外国资本外流的政府背书。【原文：US President Donald Trump praised Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, giving his endorsement to a government that’s faced a week of protests at home and an exodus of foreign capital amid a crackdown on the opposition.】

item.title: 以色列在叙利亚部署军队作为新防御理论的一部分
item.description: 头戴蓝盔的联合国维和人员大部分已不复存在，取而代之的是九个新基地中的数千名以色列士兵，他们的视野一直可以延伸到大马士革。以色列正在火山岩上挖出一条六米深（20 英尺）的壕沟，以阻挡任何滚向以色列的东西。【原文：The blue-helmeted United Nations peacekeepers are mostly gone, replaced by thousands of Israeli troops in nine new bases with vistas all the way to Damascus. A six-meter-deep (20-foot) trench is being dug out of the volcanic rock to trap anything rolling toward Israel.】

item.title: 德意志银行为 Blackstone 竞购马尔代夫水上飞机运营商 TMA 寻找贷款参与者
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士称，德意志银行正在评估潜在参与者对 2 亿美元贷款的兴趣，以支持 Blackstone Inc.【原文：Deutsche Bank AG is gauging interest from potential participants in a $200 million loan to support Blackstone Inc.’s bid for seaplane operator Trans Maldivian Airways Pvt, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Grab 为收购 GoTo 寻求高达 20 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡乘车和外卖公司 Grab Holdings Ltd. 正在洽谈筹集高达 20 亿美元的贷款，以支持其对印尼竞争对手 GoTo Group Inc.【原文：Singaporean ride and delivery firm Grab Holdings Ltd. is in talks to raise a loan of as much as $2 billion to back its potential takeover of Indonesia-based rival GoTo Group Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织初步批准向巴基斯坦提供 20 亿美元贷款
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）准备分两次向巴基斯坦提供约 20 亿美元的贷款，这表明全球贷款方对巴基斯坦政府为重建脆弱的南亚经济而进行的经济改革充满信心。【原文：International Monetary Fund is poised to disburse about $2 billion to Pakistan in two separate loans, in a show of confidence by the global lender in the government’s economic reforms to rebuild the fragile South Asian economy.】
